description:
Although the SR Latch can store one bit of data, there is no easy way to toggle its state.

The JK flip-flop solves this. It is similar, but instead of having an E input, it uses a clock signal, and updates only when the clock transitions from 0 to 1.

If J=1 and K=0, then it will set the output to 1 on the first bit.
If J=0 and K=1, then it will unset the output.
And if J=1 and K=1 then it will toggle the output.
Build a system which toggles Q every time C changes to 1.
title: JK Flip Flop
